ygData.subject: Re: 1hs vs 2hs
ygData.msgSnippet: Personally I went with 1h slashing due to luck. I obtanined a Mino Axe at lvl 7 I think. This does the same damage as a rusty 2H, but is a lot quicker. It was
ygData.messageBody:
Personally I went with 1h slashing due to luck. I obtanined a Mino Axe
at lvl 7 I think. This does the same damage as a rusty 2H, but is a lot
quicker. It was very addictive, and I just couldn't put it down to take
up 2H. When I finally decided to take up 2H, I managed to get a Dwarf
Axe, the best non magic 1H slash in the game. This is even harder to put
down since it just moevs like lightning!

Chip O'Brien wrote:

>
>
> Ug! Me agree!
>
> (/ooc: I definitely recommend 2-H slash. Primarly because you will
> hit for an average of 12-15 hits of damage on levels below 9 and this
> helps when you are fighting against creatures that run away and are
> faster than you. I hate having to fight frogloks (with 1-H slash)
> and, after hitting them several times, have them run away. I then end
> up failing to chase them (because they're faster than I am (and my
> internet connection is too slow)) and have to wait for them to run
> back and attack me (which, they unfailingly do, to their eventual
> demise (hmm...another subject here?)) This becomes a big pain when
> I'm fighting like 3 creatures and all are in various stages of running
> away/back to attack. With 2-H slash, I'm almost always able to take
> creatures out before they run away.)
>
> Azog
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Krukhan Garabash [mailto:krukhan@...]
> Sent: Thursday, April 22, 1999 4:45 PM
> To: shadowknight@onelist.com
> Subject: [shadowknight] Re: 1hs vs 2hs
>
> From: "Krukhan Garabash" <krukhan@...>
>
> - dexterity, attack skills (1h/2h slash, offense) and the "strength"
> of the mob you are fighting all seem to have an effect on your hit
> rate. in my experience, dex doesn't play a big role in this as
> anything short of a major increase (10+ points) has had no noticable
> effect.
>
> - i recommend 2h slash for beginning characters (a 2h sword will kill
> many newbie monsters in 1 or 2 good hits, greatly reducing the
> target's chances of countering) and alternation between 1h and 2h as
> necessary or when you reach a skill cap.
>
> - i can see how 1h skill could rise more rapidly that 2h as a 1h
> fighter would strike roughly 25% more in each battle than a 2h user.
> though, in my experience, the rate of increase is pretty much equal.
>
> >From: erik lawrence antonsen <eantonse@...>
> >Reply-To: shadowknight@onelist.com
> >To: shadowknight@onelist.com
> >Subject: [shadowknight] Re: 1hs vs 2hs
> >Date: Thu, 22 Apr 1999 14:09:28 -0500 (CDT)
> >
> >From: erik lawrence antonsen <eantonse@...>
> >
> >
> >I would like to know why I miss so much in battle. I was grouping
> last
> >night and while everyone else (warriors and shamans) were hitting the
>
> bad
> >guys, I had tons of misses. Is there some way that I can minimize
> it?
> >Also, I use 2-H slash because I like to look of the 2 handed axes
> even
> >though it is slower...
> >
> >Oogog
> >
> >
> >On Thu, 22 Apr 1999, Grant Vanderhule wrote:
> >
> >> From: Grant Vanderhule <vandergm@...>
> >>
> >> i also use 1hs weapons. i'm not sure about other's experience, but
> for some
> >> reason my 1hs skill seems to raise much more rapidly than my 2hs
> skill. also
> >> i prefer the speed of one hand weapons, because for some ungodly
> reason my
> >> hit rate is terrible, and the more chances to hit i get the more
> damage i
> >> do. the ability to bash is also useful. besides, if you have a
> polished
> >> granite tomahawk, what use have you for a two hander? ;)
> >>
> >>
> >>
